builder.view

Class BuilderView

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • builder.view.BuilderView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IUpdateFields, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class BuilderView
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements IUpdateFields
    BuilderView object that holds LevelBuilder application.
    Author:
    njpanzarino, jasirocki, jmmckinney
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • updateFields

        public void updateFields()
        Sync all buttons/boxes/sliders with the currentLevel parameters.
        Specified by:
        updateFields in interface IUpdateFields

      • loadFields

        public void loadFields()
        Updates the "currentLevel" model from disk based on selected levelType and number. Updates all fields.

      • loadLevelFields

        public void loadLevelFields()
        Re-Loads all fields which can vary by level type.

      • resetBoard

        public void resetBoard()
        Clears and Re-Initializes the board in a new state using the given level parameters.

      • updateParameterPanel

        public void updateParameterPanel()
        Update the parameter panel content and then update the fields within the comboBox in LevelParameterView.

      • updateLevelNums

        public void updateLevelNums()
        Update the available level numbers in the JComboBox to match the selected level type. Based on the selectedLevelClass and available levels of that type in the LevelList.

      • updateSquareTypes

        public void updateSquareTypes()
        Update the list of allowable squares in the JComboBox to match the selected level type. Based on the selected Level type and the getSquares() method in that level's class.

      • updateLevelTypes

        public void updateLevelTypes()
        Updates the list of available level types. Only called during initialization.

      • addLevelType

        public void addLevelType(java.lang.Class<? extends AbstractLevel> c)
        Adds the selected level type to the list of possible level types that can be built. This both makes them visible in the JComboBox, and gives the BuilderView all it needs to construct them.
        Parameters:
        c -
